Environment, Development and Sustainability (2023) url Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Eugénia Pedro holds a Master in Marketing and a PhD in Management from the University of Beira Interior. She is a researcher and the Organizational Management Research Line coordinator at NECE - Center for Research in Business Sciences, University of Beira Interior, Covilhã, Portugal. She integrates the ERASMUS+ START CIRCULAR project "Integrated entrepreneurship management model for circular economy". Between 2019 and 2022, she integrated the U-Value project "The impact of Higher Education Institutions on the quality of life of their regions", funded by the Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT), Portugal, and between 2015 and 2018, she was a research fellow at the same foundation. Her current research interests are about intellectual capital, efficiency, sustainability and quality of life with a special focus on higher education and regional development. Her publications include articles published in several leading scientific journals and chapters in books on these themes. She is also a member of editorial and reviewer boards of international journals. In 2019, she has won an Emerald Literati Award. Text:
Sector  — Cargos/Funções Departamento de Engenharia Eletromecânica — Docente do Departamento de Engenharia Eletromecânica Unidades Curriculares Análise de Circuitos (8540)2023 Telecomunicações (8553)2023 Telecomunicações (15275)2023 Sistemas de Comunicação (15282)2023 Controlo Discreto e Digital (15377)2023 Sistemas de Comunicação (15379)2023 Comunicações Máquina-Máquina (15403)2023 Análise de Circuitos (15753)2023 Mais Info Curriculum Vitae Fernando J. Velez (M’93–SM’05) nasceu em Benguela (Angola), a 27 de Fevereiro de
        1970. Obteve o Doutoramento em Engenharia Electrotécnica e de Computadores pelo
        Instituto Superior Técnico em 2001. Actualmente é Professor Auxiliar, na área de
        Electrotecnia e Telecomunicações, no Departamento de Engenharia Electromecânica
        (DEM) da Universidade da Beira Interior (UBI). É também investigador do Instituto
        de Telecomunicações (IT), foi Bolseiro de Investigação Marie Curie IEF no King’s
        College London em 2008/09 (OPTIMOBILE IEF) e Bolseiro Marie Curie ERG na Universidade
        da Beira Interior de 2011 a 2013 (PLANOPTI ERG). Foi um dos impulsionadores do processo de criação e instalação do IT-Laboratório
        da Covilhã em 2002 (IT-Delegação da Covilhã desde 2008), tendo sido um dos mentores
        da preparação e execução do projecto de reequipamento científico REEQ/1201/EEI/2005,
        aprovado pela FCT, que permitiu a instalação de meios laboratoriais de natureza
        experimental e computacional no IT-Covilhã, nomeadamente no Laboratório de Telecomunicações,
        localizado no DEM/UBI, e no Laboratório de Redes e Multimédia, localizado no Departamento
        de Informática/UBI. Fez ou faz parte das equipas dos projectos Europeus RACE/MBS, ACTS/SAMBA, COST 259,
        COST 273, COST 290, IST-SEACORN, IST-UNITE, COST 2100, COST IC0905 “TERRA”, COST
        IC0902 e COST IC1004. Foi ou é coordenador de seis projectos Portugueses: SAMURAI,
        MULTIPLAN, CROSSNET, MobileMAN, OPPORTUNISTIC-CR e PROENERGY-WSN. Também participa
        ou participou nos projectos SEMENTE, SMART-CLOTHING, UBIQUIMESH, NEUF ( LTE-Advanced
            Enhancements using Femtocells ) e CReATION (um projecto em linhas de excelência
        da FCT). É o coordenador do WG2 (sobre “Cognitive Radio/Software De?ned Radio Coexistence
        Studies”) do COST IC0905 “TERRA”. É autor de dois livros: WiMAX Networks: Techno-Economic
            Vision and Chalenges e Curso de Electrónica Industrial . É autor de
        115 artigos e comunicações em revistas e conferências internacionais, mais 29 em
        conferências nacionais e 13 capítulos de livro, é um membro sénior do IEEE e da
        Ordem dos Engenheiros (especialista em Telecomunicações), e é membro do IET. Em 2011, foi vice-coordenador do TPC para a Wireless Networks track na VTC
        2011-Spring - 2011 IEEE 73 rd Vehicular Technology Conference ,
        realizada em Maio, em Budapeste, Hungria. É membro do editorial board do IJEHMC - International
        Journal of E-Health and Medical Communications , desde Fevereiro de 2009 e do Journal of Green Engineering , da River Publishers, desde 2010. Em 2011/12,
        Foi o co-guest editor do Journal of Green Engineering , Special Issue
        on “Cognitive Radio and the Application to Green Communications: Technical, Economic,
        and Regulatory Viewpoints” . Fernando Velez também é o editor-in-chief do Journal of Ambient Wireless Communications and Smart Environments ,
        desde 2013. O Prof. Velez é o coordenador do IEEE VTS Portugal Chapter desde 2006, coordenador
        dos VTS Region 8 (Europa e África) Chapters desde 2010, membro da comissão de coordenação
        da especialização em Telecomunicações da Ordem dos Engenheiros (OE) desde 2007 e
        coordenador adjunto dessa mesma Comissão da OE desde 2013. Orientou ou está a orientar
        cerca de vinte projectos finais de licenciatura, dois Mestrados pré-Bolonha, treze
        dissertações de Mestrado de 2.º ciclo, dezenas de bolseiros e nove alunos de doutoramento. Recebeu duas vezes (1996 e 1997) o Prémio Inovação Jovem Engenheiro pela Ordem dos Engenheiros (EUREL), em 1996 com o trabalho "Planeamento Microcelular e Determinação da Capacidade em Sistemas de Comunicações Móveis em Ambiente Urbano na Banda da Ondas Milimétricas" e em 1997 com o trabalho "Critérios de Optimização para Sistema de Comunicações Móveis Celulares nas Bandas de 40 e 60 GHz". Também foi premiado no concurso COMUNICAÇÕES 96, promovido pelo Instituto de Comunicações de Portugal, com a dissertação de Mestrado "Uma Ferramenta Interactiva de Planeamento Microcelular para Comunicações Móveis em Ambiente Urbano na Banda das Ondas Milimétricas". Recebeu o Best Paper Prize na 3G 2004 - 5 th IEE International Conference on 3G Mobile Communication Technologies , em Londres, Reino Unido, e os seus alunos têm também recebido diversos prémios ou menções honrosas para o melhor artigo em Conferências Internacionais. As suas áreas principais de investigação são ferramentas celulares do planeamento, tráfego da mobilidade, simulação de redes móveis e sem fios, optimização inter-camada, interoperabilidade, partilha, coexistência e agregação de espectro, tráfego do multi-serviço e optimização custo/proveito de sistemas de comunicação móveis avançados. Contactos fjvðubi÷pt 275329919 3953 3919 CienciaVitae.pt

Velez (M’93–SM’05) nasceu em Benguela (Angola), a 27 de Fevereiro de
        1970. Obteve o Doutoramento em Engenharia Electrotécnica e de Computadores pelo
        Instituto Superior Técnico em 2001. Actualmente é Professor Auxiliar, na área de
        Electrotecnia e Telecomunicações, no Departamento de Engenharia Electromecânica
        (DEM) da Universidade da Beira Interior (UBI). É também investigador do Instituto
        de Telecomunicações (IT), foi Bolseiro de Investigação Marie Curie IEF no King’s
        College London em 2008/09 (OPTIMOBILE IEF) e Bolseiro Marie Curie ERG na Universidade
        da Beira Interior de 2011 a 2013 (PLANOPTI ERG). Foi um dos impulsionadores do processo de criação e instalação do IT-Laboratório
        da Covilhã em 2002 (IT-Delegação da Covilhã desde 2008), tendo sido um dos mentores
        da preparação e execução do projecto de reequipamento científico REEQ/1201/EEI/2005,
        aprovado pela FCT, que permitiu a instalação de meios laboratoriais de natureza
        experimental e computacional no IT-Covilhã, nomeadamente no Laboratório de Telecomunicações,
        localizado no DEM/UBI, e no Laboratório de Redes e Multimédia, localizado no Departamento
        de Informática/UBI. Fez ou faz parte das equipas dos projectos Europeus RACE/MBS, ACTS/SAMBA, COST 259,
        COST 273, COST 290, IST-SEACORN, IST-UNITE, COST 2100, COST IC0905 “TERRA”, COST
        IC0902 e COST IC1004. Foi ou é coordenador de seis projectos Portugueses: SAMURAI,
        MULTIPLAN, CROSSNET, MobileMAN, OPPORTUNISTIC-CR e PROENERGY-WSN. Também participa
        ou participou nos projectos SEMENTE, SMART-CLOTHING, UBIQUIMESH, NEUF ( LTE-Advanced
            Enhancements using Femtocells ) e CReATION (um projecto em linhas de excelência
        da FCT). É o coordenador do WG2 (sobre “Cognitive Radio/Software De?ned Radio Coexistence
        Studies”) do COST IC0905 “TERRA”. É autor de dois livros: WiMAX Networks: Techno-Economic
            Vision and Chalenges e Curso de Electrónica Industrial . É autor de
        115 artigos e comunicações em revistas e conferências internacionais, mais 29 em
        conferências nacionais e 13 capítulos de livro, é um membro sénior do IEEE e da
        Ordem dos Engenheiros (especialista em Telecomunicações), e é membro do IET. Em 2011, foi vice-coordenador do TPC para a Wireless Networks track na VTC
        2011-Spring - 2011 IEEE 73 rd Vehicular Technology Conference ,
        realizada em Maio, em Budapeste, Hungria. É membro do editorial board do IJEHMC - International
        Journal of E-Health and Medical Communications , desde Fevereiro de 2009 e do Journal of Green Engineering , da River Publishers, desde 2010. Em 2011/12,
        Foi o co-guest editor do Journal of Green Engineering , Special Issue
        on “Cognitive Radio and the Application to Green Communications: Technical, Economic,
        and Regulatory Viewpoints” . Fernando Velez também é o editor-in-chief do Journal of Ambient Wireless Communications and Smart Environments ,
        desde 2013. O Prof. Velez é o coordenador do IEEE VTS Portugal Chapter desde 2006, coordenador
        dos VTS Region 8 (Europa e África) Chapters desde 2010, membro da comissão de coordenação
        da especialização em Telecomunicações da Ordem dos Engenheiros (OE) desde 2007 e
        coordenador adjunto dessa mesma Comissão da OE desde 2013. Orientou ou está a orientar
        cerca de vinte projectos finais de licenciatura, dois Mestrados pré-Bolonha, treze
        dissertações de Mestrado de 2.º ciclo, dezenas de bolseiros e nove alunos de doutoramento. Recebeu duas vezes (1996 e 1997) o Prémio Inovação Jovem Engenheiro pela Ordem dos Engenheiros (EUREL), em 1996 com o trabalho "Planeamento Microcelular e Determinação da Capacidade em Sistemas de Comunicações Móveis em Ambiente Urbano na Banda da Ondas Milimétricas" e em 1997 com o trabalho "Critérios de Optimização para Sistema de Comunicações Móveis Celulares nas Bandas de 40 e 60 GHz". Também foi premiado no concurso COMUNICAÇÕES 96, promovido pelo Instituto de Comunicações de Portugal, com a dissertação de Mestrado "Uma Ferramenta Interactiva de Planeamento Microcelular para Comunicações Móveis em Ambiente Urbano na Banda das Ondas Milimétricas". Recebeu o Best Paper Prize na 3G 2004 - 5 th IEE International Conference on 3G Mobile Communication Technologies , em Londres, Reino Unido, e os seus alunos têm também recebido diversos prémios ou menções honrosas para o melhor artigo em Conferências Internacionais. As suas áreas principais de investigação são ferramentas celulares do planeamento, tráfego da mobilidade, simulação de redes móveis e sem fios, optimização inter-camada, interoperabilidade, partilha, coexistência e agregação de espectro, tráfego do multi-serviço e optimização custo/proveito de sistemas de comunicação móveis avançados.

Publicado Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Data e local de nascimento : 28/09/1962 ; LisboaSituação conjugal e familiar : união de facto, dois filhos, Edna com 26 anos e Pedro com 24 anos Licenciada em Sociologia e Mestre em Sociologia da Família pelo ISCTE, concluiu o doutoramento na Universidade da Beira Interior em 2008 com orientação científica da Professora Karin Wall do Instituto de Ciências Sociais de Lisboa. Professora Auxiliar no Departamento de Sociologia da UBI desde 2008 e investigadora no Centro de Investigação e Estudos de Sociologia (CIES_ISCTE). Os seus principais interesses de investigação incidem na área da Família, Género, Sexualidades e Metodologias Qualitativas. Foi membro da Comissão Científica do Curso de 2º ciclo/Mestrado em Sociologia: Exclusões e Políticas Sociais da UBI e lecionou/leciona neste curso as disciplinas «Família e Curso de Vida», «Problemáticas de Género» e «Metodologias de Investigação». Foi professora convidada na Escola Superior de Educação de Setúbal (1989/1990) e participou em projetos de Apoio a Mulheres Desempregadas (iniciativa comunitária NOW), na Covilhã, e de combate à exclusão social com jovens moradores em bairros pobres da periferia de Lisboa. No período 2018-2022 integrou a equipa do projeto PARENT_ Procriação e Parentalidade em contexto de baixa fecundidade, mudança familiar e crise económica (PTDC/SOCSOC/29367/2017) do Instituto de Ciências Sociais da Universidade de LisboaShe can be contacted at: namesantos@sapo.pt Personal-webpage: https://ciencia.iscte-iul.pt/public/person/m13420@iscte.pt Projectos e Financiamentos (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Projeto Parent-Procriação e Parentalidade em contexto de baixa fecundidade, mudança familiar e crise económica PTDC/SOCSOC/ 29367/2017 2018 - 2022/9/30 ( Concluído ) European Interaction European Interaction Guidelines for Education Professionals when working with Children in Juvenile Justice Learning Contexts N.º 562146EPP-1-2015-1-PTEPPKA3PI- 2015 - 2018/12/1 ( Concluído ) Father in leave N.º 562146EPP-1-2015-1-PTEPPKA3PI- 2011 - 2011/12/31 ( Concluído ) Publicações Ver publicações . Publicado Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Francisco Miguel Pereira Brardo Ferreira is assistant professor at the University of Beira Interior. In 1996, he graduated in Applied Physics-Optical Branch with a specialization in Optometry and in 2010 completed his PhD in Physics at the University of Beira Interior. Actually, he is director of the Clinical and Experimental Center in Vision Sciences and researcher at the Center for Research in Health Sciences (CICS) at the University of Beira Interior. The research area is related to Health Sciences with an emphasis on the primary visual health care field. He is interested in the anterior ocular segment and related diseases, ocular optical coherent tomography, electroretinography and neurophysiology of the vision. Currently, he supervises two PhD thesis and is a member of the editorial board of the journal Acta Scientific Ophthalmology and a reviewer of the journal Optometry and Vision Science and Porto Biomedical Journal. Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Professor Catedrático da Universidade da Beira Interior (ubi.pt), onde lecciona desde 2000. É doutorado em Belas Artes / Desenho pela Universidade do País Basco, Bilbau, licenciado em Arquitectura pela Universidade de Coimbra e licenciado em Design pela Faculdade de Belas Artes da Universidade de Lisboa. Dirigiu o curso de Design Multimédia e o Doutoramento em Media Artes da UBI e coordena o Grupo de Investigação em Artes do Labcom (labcom.ubi.pt), no âmbito do qual desenvolve pesquisa e criação sobre processos espácio-temporais, intermedialidade e identidade nas Artes (Media Artes, Design e Arquitectura). Participa regularmente em comissões científicas de eventos e publicações especializadas, tendo sido professor visitante em várias escolas europeias. Coordenador científico da DESIGNA, Conferência Internacional de Investigação em Design (designa.ubi.pt), da plataforma Montanha Mágica* Arte e Paisagem (montanhamagica.ubi.pt) e das Jornadas de Investigação em Artes (iartes.ubi.pt). Foi Director Executivo e coordenador do Conselho de Curadoria da Candidatura da Covilhã a Cidade Criativa da UNESCO em Design (covilhacriativa.com), aprovada em 2021. Integra a Coolabora, cooperativa de intervenção social. Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Gisela Marques Pereira Gonçalves holds a PhD in Communication Sciences. She is Associate Professor at the University of Beira Interior (UBI) and coordinator of the Strategic Communication research group of LabCom - a Communication research centre. Vice-president of the Faculty of Arts and Letters, she is the coordinator of the post-graduation studies in Strategic Communication at UBI. She has authored 2 books, edited 17 collective volumes, published around one hundred scientific publications, supervised 4 PhD theses and 39 Master dissertations. Former chair of the ECREA Strategic and Organizational Communication Section. She is the editor-in-chief of Estudos de Comunicação, a Portuguese journal indexed in Scopus. Her research interest’s concern: ethics, public relations, political and strategic communication, crises and risk communication. She is Vice-President of Sopcom, the Portuguese Association of Communication Sciences. Nota_Biografica: (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Gisela Marques Pereira Gonçalves holds a PhD in Communication Sciences. She is Associate Professor at the University of Beira Interior (UBI) and coordinator of the Strategic Communication research group of LabCom - a Communication research centre. Vice-president of the Faculty of Arts and Letters, she is the coordinator of the post-graduation studies in Strategic Communication at UBI. She has authored 2 books, edited 17 collective volumes, published around one hundred scientific publications, supervised 4 PhD theses and 39 Master dissertations. Former chair of the ECREA Strategic and Organizational Communication Section. She is the editor-in-chief of Estudos de Comunicação, a Portuguese journal indexed in Scopus. Her research interest’s concern: ethics, public relations, political and strategic communication, crises and risk communication. She is Vice-President of Sopcom, the Portuguese Association of Communication Sciences. He is an Invited Assistant Professor at the Universidade da Beira Interior , an Invited Adjunct Professor at the Instituto Politécnico de Tomar. Member of LabCom - Communication and Arts (https://labcomca.ubi.pt/). Composition and Musical Analysis teacher at the Academia de Música e Dança do Fundão, Conservatório Regional de Música da Covilhã, Conservatório de Música da Guarda and Escola de Música do Centro de Cultura Pedro Ãlvares Cabral. In addition to other artistic work, he has collaborated with Teatro das Beiras (usually with director Gil Salgueiro Nave), composing original music, being musical director and sound designer (11th time in February 2024)Author of the book "O som e a música no cinema português contemporâneo - processos criativos - seguido de entrevistas" (Edições Documenta, 2023). Publicado Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Henrique Pereira Neiva is a Professor in the Department of Sport Sciences at the University of Beira Interior and a member of the Research Center in Sports Sciences, Health Sciences and Human Development (CIDESD). Concluded his degree in Sport and Physical Education in the Faculty of Sport of the University of Porto and, in 2015, finished his PhD in Sport Sciences at the University of Beira Interior with the thesis "The effect of warm-up on swimming performance: the impact of volume, intensity and post warm-up recovery in elite swimmers", supported by a grant from the Science and Technology Foundation (SFRH/BD/74950/2010), and with the final grade of Excellent. In the last 5 years, more than 130 documents were produced, among books, book chapters papers in Journals indexed at the Web of Science Core Collection and in other international scientific journals, conference proceedings, and all peer-reviewed publications. The impact of the research in the last years was recognized: invitation for oral communications in national and international conferences, editing and peer-reviews in high-ranked journals, supervision of Doctoral (7 completed), Master (35 completed) and Bachelor students. Participates and/or participated as PhD Student Fellow in 1 project(s), Post-doc Fellow in 1 project(s), Principal investigator in 2 project(s), Researcher in 2 project(s) and Supervisor in 1 project(s). Works in the area(s) of Medical and Health Sciences with emphasis on Health Sciences with emphasis on Sport and Fitness Sciences. His investigation has focused on training control and evaluation, strength training, and endurance training in different populations. Recently he has been involved in several investigations regarding the effects of physical exercise in the elderly. He was a competitive swimmer from 1991 until 2013, representing the national swimming team 30 times, medalled in the Junior European Championships, national record holder and national champion several times. He was also a swimming coach for 10 years Distinções e Prémios (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Prémio 2020 Prémio António Paula Brito, atribuído nas XXI Jornadas da Sociedade Portuguesa de Psicologia do Desporto 2020 Prémio “2ª Melhor Comunicação Livre”, na área do Fitness e Terapia Aquática, no 43º Congresso Técnico-Científico da Associação Portuguesa de Técnicos de Natação. - Associação Portuguesa de Técnicos de Natação , Rio Maior , Santarém , Portugal 2020 Menção Honrosa pela excelente tese de Doutoramento intitulada: “The Bright and Dark side of motivation in exercise: promoting persistence and adherence” do Filipe Rodrigues, sob orientação de Diogo Monteiro e Henrique Neiva - Centro de Investigação em Desporto Saúde e Desenvolvimento Humano , Vila Real , Vila Real , Portugal 2019 Prémio de Menção Honrosa do “Prémio COP/Fundação Millennium BCP Ciências do Desporto”, no tema de Psicologia e Pedagogia do Desporto - Comité Olímpico Português , Lisboa , Lisboa , Portugal 2017 Honorable mention of COP/Fundação Millenium BCP Sport Sciences: Sports medicine subject (research: Loads of schoolar bags. João Barbosa, Daniel Marinho, Tiago Barbosa, Henrique Neiva, Mikel Izquierdo, & Mário Marques) - Comité Olímpico Português , Lisboa , Lisboa , Portugal 2016 Honorable mention for excelent PhD thesis. - Centro de Investigação em Desporto Saúde e Desenvolvimento Humano , Vila Real , Vila Real , Portugal 2016 Best oral communication in International Congress CIDESD 2016, Exercise and Health, Sports and Human Development, entitled Are stretching routines harmful for sprint performance when added to warm-up?”. Évora, 11 e 12 de novembro de 2016. - Centro de Investigação em Desporto Saúde e Desenvolvimento Humano , Vila Real , Vila Real , Portugal 2015 Prize "Best oral communication”, in Fitness subject, in the 38º Congresso Técnico-Científico da Associação Portuguesa de Técnicos de Natação. Nota_Biografica: (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Henrique Pereira Neiva is a Professor in the Department of Sport Sciences at the University of Beira Interior and a member of the Research Center in Sports Sciences, Health Sciences and Human Development (CIDESD). Concluded his degree in Sport and Physical Education in the Faculty of Sport of the University of Porto and, in 2015, finished his PhD in Sport Sciences at the University of Beira Interior with the thesis "The effect of warm-up on swimming performance: the impact of volume, intensity and post warm-up recovery in elite swimmers", supported by a grant from the Science and Technology Foundation (SFRH/BD/74950/2010), and with the final grade of Excellent. In the last 5 years, more than 130 documents were produced, among books, book chapters papers in Journals indexed at the Web of Science Core Collection and in other international scientific journals, conference proceedings, and all peer-reviewed publications. The impact of the research in the last years was recognized: invitation for oral communications in national and international conferences, editing and peer-reviews in high-ranked journals, supervision of Doctoral (7 completed), Master (35 completed) and Bachelor students. Participates and/or participated as PhD Student Fellow in 1 project(s), Post-doc Fellow in 1 project(s), Principal investigator in 2 project(s), Researcher in 2 project(s) and Supervisor in 1 project(s). Works in the area(s) of Medical and Health Sciences with emphasis on Health Sciences with emphasis on Sport and Fitness Sciences. His investigation has focused on training control and evaluation, strength training, and endurance training in different populations. Recently he has been involved in several investigations regarding the effects of physical exercise in the elderly. He was a competitive swimmer from 1991 until 2013, representing the national swimming team 30 times, medalled in the Junior European Championships, national record holder and national champion several times. He was also a swimming coach for 10 years Distinções e Prémios (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Prémio 2020 Prémio António Paula Brito, atribuído nas XXI Jornadas da Sociedade Portuguesa de Psicologia do Desporto 2020 Prémio “2ª Melhor Comunicação Livre”, na área do Fitness e Terapia Aquática, no 43º Congresso Técnico-Científico da Associação Portuguesa de Técnicos de Natação. - Associação Portuguesa de Técnicos de Natação , Rio Maior , Santarém , Portugal 2020 Menção Honrosa pela excelente tese de Doutoramento intitulada: “The Bright and Dark side of motivation in exercise: promoting persistence and adherence” do Filipe Rodrigues, sob orientação de Diogo Monteiro e Henrique Neiva - Centro de Investigação em Desporto Saúde e Desenvolvimento Humano , Vila Real , Vila Real , Portugal 2019 Prémio de Menção Honrosa do “Prémio COP/Fundação Millennium BCP Ciências do Desporto”, no tema de Psicologia e Pedagogia do Desporto - Comité Olímpico Português , Lisboa , Lisboa , Portugal 2017 Honorable mention of COP/Fundação Millenium BCP Sport Sciences: Sports medicine subject (research: Loads of schoolar bags. Published Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Joana Ricarte is an integrated researcher at the Center for Interdisciplinary Studies (CEIS20) and guest assistant professor of Cultural Heritage and Museology at the Faculty of Humanities and Arts (FLUC), both at the University of Coimbra. A historian and political scientist with expertise in identity and conflict studies, her work has been interdisciplinary, in the intersection between International Relations, History, European Studies, Political Psychology and Sociology. She is the author of The Impact of Protracted Peace Processes on Identities in Conflict: the case of Israel and Palestine (Palgrave MacMillan, 2023), team member and coordinator of several research projects funded by national and international programmes, including Principal Investigator at OppAttune: Countering Oppositional Political Extremism through Attuned Dialogue: Track, Attune, Limit (Horizon Europe, 2023-2026), funded by the European Commission. 

The international projection of Dr. Ricarte''s work has been translated into a vast network and collaborations with other institutions. She is currently an Associate Researcher at the Center for Peace and Conflict Studies (CCP) of the International Relations Research Group (NUPRI) of the University of São Paulo (USP), Brazil; collaborator researcher at the University of Coimbra''s Institute for Legal Research (UCILeR); Advisory Board Member of the Organisation for Identity and Cultural Development (OICD), in the UK; and elected Governing Board Member of the European International Studies Association (EISA). Her previous positions include Invited Assistant Professor in the Department Sociology, MA program in International Relations, at the University of Beira Interior (UBI); Postdoctoral researcher at the University of Coimbra Institute for Legal Research (UCILeR), at the Communication and Society Research Centre (CECS) of the University of Minho and at the Center for Interdisciplinary Studies (CEIS20) of the University of Coimbra. 

Dr. Ricarte''s research interests include critical perspectives on identity building, peace, violence(s) and conflict, particularly in the European context and the Middle East, as well as interpretative research, post-positivism and qualitative methodology. Her overall work has sought to explain how dynamics of identity, power and otherness shape protracted social conflicts in both domestic and International levels and how these are related with the maintenance and perpetuation of conflict through time. Her current work has been revolving around concepts/themes such as protracted peace processes, othering and dehumanisation, everyday extremism and ontological (in)security. PhD in Economics (2004), UBI; Habilitation in Technological Change and Entrepreneurship (2017), IST, University of Lisbon, Portugal Director of the UBIExecutive, Business School. Vice-coordinator and full researcher of the NECE, Research Center in Business Sciences, UBI. Collaborator researcher at the CEG-IST - Centre for Management Studies of Instituto Superior Técnico, Associate researcher of the ICS - Instituto de Ciências Sociais, University of Lisbon and External researcher at the IME - Instituto Multidisciplinar de Empresa, Universidad de Salamanca. President of the Associação Portuguesa para o Desenvolvimento Regional (APDR), Portuguese Section of the European Regional Science Association (ERSA). Member of the Strategic Council of the Ordem dos Economistas. Senior member of the Ordem dos Economistas, College of Business Economics and Management Editor of the Springer Book Series: Studies in Entrepreneurship, Structural Change and Industrial Dynamics (ESCID), indexed in SCOPUS; and Business Model Research (BMR). Member of: the MIT Technology Review Global Panel, a community of business professionals; the EIT Food RIS Policy Council; and the EIT Food South Experts. Text: Sector  — Cargos/Funções C-MADE | Centre of Materials and Building Technologies — Coordenador/a do C-MADE - Center of Materials and Building Technologies Departamento de Engenharia Civil e Arquitetura — Docente do Departamento de Civil e Arquitetura Biografia João Castro Gomes has been the professor and leader of the Centre of Materials and Building Technologies Research Unit at the University of Beira Interior since January 2007. João Castro Gomes graduated from the University of Minho with a degree in Civil Engineering. He completed his PhD studies at the University of Leeds in 1997. After the doctoral degree, he worked as a university lecturer and was responsible for research groups until his appointment to the professorship. He develops research and innovation in sustainable materials and construction for a competitive and climate-neutral circular economy, namely in developing eco-materials obtained by co-utilisation of waste and carbon dioxide. He was awarded several prizes related to waste co-utilization and carbon utilisation in the construction industry. Patentes/Patents Process for obtaining CaO-MgO binders and construction products with reuse of subproducts and/or residues and absorption of carbon dioxide Número: 110895 Proprietário: Universidade da Beira Interior Estado: Concedida/Emitida Data de Emissão: 2020-03-02 Sistema de peças modulares para execução de superficies ajardinadas com capacidade de melhorar termicamente a envolvente edificada Número: 109260 Proprietário: Universidade da Beira Interior Estado: Concedida/Emitida Data de Emissão: 2017-09-28 Agregados leves impregnados por imersão com materiais de mudança de fase e selagem superficial por molhagem com revestimentos à prova de água Número: 108276 Proprietário: Universidade da Beira Interior Estado: Concedida/Emitida Data de Emissão: 2016-09-12 Conjunto acoplável de peças modulares para execução de superfícies ajardinadas Número: PT106022 (A) Proprietário: Universidade da Beira Interior Estado: Concedida/Emitida Data de Emissão: 2013-07-03 Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) João Castro Gomes, a Professor at the University of Beira Interior (UBI) and leader of the Centre of Materials and Building Technologies Research Unit since January 2007, has significantly advanced the field of sustainable construction materials. Graduating from the University of Minho with a degree in Civil Engineering and completing his PhD at the University of Leeds in 1997, João has developed eco-materials through waste and carbon dioxide co-utilization. His pioneering work in reducing the construction industry's carbon footprint has earned him several awards. João's commitment to sustainability extends to education and mentorship, emphasising the importance of scientific careers in global sustainability. Distinções e Prémios (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Prémio 2022 Award in the Born for Knowledge National Contest with the BoB - Building Out of the Box project, developed by students from the University of Beira Interior (UBI), Pedro Silva and Bruno Gomes, and mentored by João Castro Gomes - Agência Nacional de Inovação SA , Porto , Porto , Portugal 2021 Korea Resources Recycling Association 2021 awarded the Almonty Korea Tungsten Corporation and the National University of Seoul for a novel mine waste recycling solution supported by João Castro Gomes - Korea Resources Corporation (KORES) , Gangwon-do , South Korea , Coreia do Sul 2020 1st Prize awarded by TAKE-OFF Project - Building Global Technology Entrepreneurs for Advanced Materials given to DARKCO2 business idea, developed by João Castro Gomes. - TAKE-OFF Project - Building Global Technology Entrepreneurs for Advanced Materials , Aveiro , Averio , Portugal 2019 Winner idea within- Promove Regiões Fronteiriças/Promoting Border Regions - 2019 edition, supported by the La Caixa Foundation / BPI with the CO2LLECT project "selected idea" - proposal developed by Janine Ayoub, Mantas Sevelkovas, and João Castro Gomes - La Caixa Foundation / BPI , Lisboa , Lisboa , Portugal 2018 1st Prize Climatelaunchpad Global Grand Final and Sustainable Production Systems theme Award Climatelaunchpad (2018). Awards given to eCO2blocks idea (best green business idea out of 135), developed by João Castro Gomes and Pedro Humbert. 2018 1st Prize Manuel António da Mota Award (2018). Awarded to UBI for eCO2blocks idea/project for developing a pilot production of building blocks obtained with industrial waste, without using potable water, with high absorption of CO2. 2018 1st Prize Award CEBT Ibérico at Universidade da Beira Interior (2018). Award given to GEOGREEN testbed project developed by João Castro Gomes and Maria Manso. CEBT Ibérico is supported by INESPO III (Innovation Network Spain-Portugal). Castro-Gomes is currently conducting research activities in the following areas: Up-Cycling Wastes into Smart Cementitious Materials; Storage of CO2 and Methane in Concrete Materials; Durability Testing Methods of Cementitious Materials; Effect of Climate Change on Critical Infrastructure. ColunaNome: João Castro Gomes Professor/a Catedrático/a
Sector_Cargos: C-MADE | Centre of Materials and Building Technologies — Coordenador/a do C-MADE - Center of Materials and Building Technologies Departamento de Engenharia Civil e Arquitetura — Docente do Departamento de Civil e Arquitetura Biografia João Castro Gomes has been the professor and leader of the Centre of Materials and Building Technologies Research Unit at the University of Beira Interior since January 2007. João Castro Gomes graduated from the University of Minho with a degree in Civil Engineering. He completed his PhD studies at the University of Leeds in 1997. After the doctoral degree, he worked as a university lecturer and was responsible for research groups until his appointment to the professorship. He develops research and innovation in sustainable materials and construction for a competitive and climate-neutral circular economy, namely in developing eco-materials obtained by co-utilisation of waste and carbon dioxide. He was awarded several prizes related to waste co-utilization and carbon utilisation in the construction industry. Diretor/a do(s) curso(s) Engenharia Civil — Departamento de Engenharia Civil e Arquitetura

Nota_Biografica: (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) João Castro Gomes, a Professor at the University of Beira Interior (UBI) and leader of the Centre of Materials and Building Technologies Research Unit since January 2007, has significantly advanced the field of sustainable construction materials. Graduating from the University of Minho with a degree in Civil Engineering and completing his PhD at the University of Leeds in 1997, João has developed eco-materials through waste and carbon dioxide co-utilization. His pioneering work in reducing the construction industry's carbon footprint has earned him several awards. João's commitment to sustainability extends to education and mentorship, emphasising the importance of scientific careers in global sustainability. Distinções e Prémios (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Prémio 2022 Award in the Born for Knowledge National Contest with the BoB - Building Out of the Box project, developed by students from the University of Beira Interior (UBI), Pedro Silva and Bruno Gomes, and mentored by João Castro Gomes - Agência Nacional de Inovação SA , Porto , Porto , Portugal 2021 Korea Resources Recycling Association 2021 awarded the Almonty Korea Tungsten Corporation and the National University of Seoul for a novel mine waste recycling solution supported by João Castro Gomes - Korea Resources Corporation (KORES) , Gangwon-do , South Korea , Coreia do Sul 2020 1st Prize awarded by TAKE-OFF Project - Building Global Technology Entrepreneurs for Advanced Materials given to DARKCO2 business idea, developed by João Castro Gomes. - TAKE-OFF Project - Building Global Technology Entrepreneurs for Advanced Materials , Aveiro , Averio , Portugal 2019 Winner idea within- Promove Regiões Fronteiriças/Promoting Border Regions - 2019 edition, supported by the La Caixa Foundation / BPI with the CO2LLECT project "selected idea" - proposal developed by Janine Ayoub, Mantas Sevelkovas, and João Castro Gomes - La Caixa Foundation / BPI , Lisboa , Lisboa , Portugal 2018 1st Prize Climatelaunchpad Global Grand Final and Sustainable Production Systems theme Award Climatelaunchpad (2018). Awards given to eCO2blocks idea (best green business idea out of 135), developed by João Castro Gomes and Pedro Humbert. 2018 1st Prize Manuel António da Mota Award (2018). Awarded to UBI for eCO2blocks idea/project for developing a pilot production of building blocks obtained with industrial waste, without using potable water, with high absorption of CO2. 2018 1st Prize Award CEBT Ibérico at Universidade da Beira Interior (2018). Award given to GEOGREEN testbed project developed by João Castro Gomes and Maria Manso. CEBT Ibérico is supported by INESPO III (Innovation Network Spain-Portugal). Ferreira is Associate Professor at the University of Beira Interior (UBI), Portugal. He holds a PhD in Entrepreneurship and Small Business Management from the Autonomous University of Barcelona (UAB), Spain. Currently, he is the scientific coordinator of the UBI Research Unit for Business Sciences (NECE), Portugal. He has edited or co-edited several books on strategy, innovation and entrepreneurship and published over 200 papers in premier international journals, including Technological Forecasting & Social Change, Journal of Business Research, Journal of Cleaner Production, Management Decision, and Service Business. He is Associate Editor of Management Decision, and his research interests include strategy, competitiveness and entrepreneurship. Publicado Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) João Nunes-Pereira (JNP) received the PhD degree in Science (Physics) in 2013, the MSc degree in Physics in 2009, and the BSc degree in Physics and Chemistry in 2006, all from the University of Minho, Braga, Portugal. He has over 50 publications in high-impact journals and 3 book chapters with more than 2200 citations, an h-index of 27 (SCOPUS), and over 40 scientific communications. He participated in 20 scientific projects and has supervised/tutored more than 25 postgraduate students (PhD and MSc). Since 2014, JNP has been conducting research activities in the field of Materials Science and Engineering, developing multifunctional polymer- or ceramic-based composites for applications in various industries, such as aeronautical, aerospace, environmental, biomedical, etc. In 2022, JNP became an Invited Assistant Researcher at the Department of Electromechanical Engineering at the University of Beira Interior (UBI) in the field of Materials ScienceSince 2023, JNP is an Assistant Researcher at the Centre for Mechanical and Aerospace Science and Technologies (C-MAST) at UBI, working on the development of multifunctional structural composites with self-sensing and self-healing capabilities based on recyclable materials (Project EcoSensHeal: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7j6ydQzv1Uo&ab_channel=UBIUniversidadedaBeiraInterior). Nota_Biografica: (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) João Nunes-Pereira (JNP) received the PhD degree in Science (Physics) in 2013, the MSc degree in Physics in 2009, and the BSc degree in Physics and Chemistry in 2006, all from the University of Minho, Braga, Portugal. He has over 50 publications in high-impact journals and 3 book chapters with more than 2200 citations, an h-index of 27 (SCOPUS), and over 40 scientific communications. He participated in 20 scientific projects and has supervised/tutored more than 25 postgraduate students (PhD and MSc). Since 2014, JNP has been conducting research activities in the field of Materials Science and Engineering, developing multifunctional polymer- or ceramic-based composites for applications in various industries, such as aeronautical, aerospace, environmental, biomedical, etc. In 2022, JNP became an Invited Assistant Researcher at the Department of Electromechanical Engineering at the University of Beira Interior (UBI) in the field of Materials ScienceSince 2023, JNP is an Assistant Researcher at the Centre for Mechanical and Aerospace Science and Technologies (C-MAST) at UBI, working on the development of multifunctional structural composites with self-sensing and self-healing capabilities based on recyclable materials (Project EcoSensHeal: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7j6ydQzv1Uo&ab_channel=UBIUniversidadedaBeiraInterior). In Linha do Horizonte 4 . Portugal, 2016. Publicado Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Jorge Humberto Canastra Marum, born in Matosinhos in 1979, has built an extensive career in academia and researchHe was a FCT research fellow in 2006 and currently holds a position as a tenured Assistant Professor at the University of Beira Interior''s Department of Civil Engineering and Architecture. Celebrating 20 years of teaching in the Architecture course at UBI, his teaching expertise is recognized internationally, having served as a visiting lecturer at TUDelft in the Netherlands, ETSAVA in Valladolid, the Dipartimento di Culture del Progetto at UniversitÃ  Iuav di Venezia, National Technical University of Athens, and Faculty of Architecture at the University of PortoMarum is the coordinator of the 5th year and teaches ''Design V'' at UBI''s Integrated Master in Architecture, and he also leads the optional course ''Architectural Design Communication''He lectures and oversees the ''Design and Building Seminar I'' in UBI''s Doctoral Program in Architecture. Throughout his tenure, he has taught various theoretical and practical subjects, primarily in Architectural Design courses, occasionally branching out to ''Urban Design'' and ''Drawing and Geometry'' from the 1st to the 5th year at UBI¿s Master in Architecture. His research involvement is as significant as his teaching. He is the lead researcher on the R&D project in collaboration with the public administration, titled "Research and Architectural Practice Project for the creation of the Trancoso Museum, Rehabilitation of the Solar dos Costas, Lopes e Tavares, and Requalification of Largo Doutor Eduardo Cabral," Ref. MDT-R2-2020, and on the project "Research and Dissemination on the Architectural and Cultural Heritage of the Historic Center of Trancoso" Ref. PAT-CHT-2019/CVP-730110000-6, ongoing since 2020He also participates in the international R&D project "Planimetric, spatial and photogrammetric analysis of pioneering audiovisual installations in the Iberian Peninsula since 1975" Ref. PGC2018-095359-B-I00 (UV-ETSA) funded by Spain''s Ministry of Science, Innovation, and Universities and the "Contrast: Network of multidisciplinary artistic initiatives in Art, Architecture, Design and Photography" (FAUP-ACC) financed by DGArtes. As a researcher, he has conducted scientific research evaluations as an expert member of the Erasmus+ Program''s R&D project proposals and final report evaluators'' pool for 2021-2027 and as an expert of the Santander Scientific Initiation Scholarship evaluators'' poolHe coordinated a highly rated R&D Unit and a 4.5 million euros architectural project obtained through an agreement between UBI and the public administration (Ref. MDT-R2-2020) Trancoso Municipality. Marum has supervised several Master''s dissertations in Architecture and currently mentors 2 Ph.D. students with FCT-funded scholarships. Several of these dissertations have been awarded scientific merit prizes in national and international student competitions, like the Valor Pneu Award and Archiprix Portugal, reflecting the scientific community''s recognition. Nota_Biografica: (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Jorge Humberto Canastra Marum, born in Matosinhos in 1979, has built an extensive career in academia and researchHe was a FCT research fellow in 2006 and currently holds a position as a tenured Assistant Professor at the University of Beira Interior''s Department of Civil Engineering and Architecture. Celebrating 20 years of teaching in the Architecture course at UBI, his teaching expertise is recognized internationally, having served as a visiting lecturer at TUDelft in the Netherlands, ETSAVA in Valladolid, the Dipartimento di Culture del Progetto at UniversitÃ  Iuav di Venezia, National Technical University of Athens, and Faculty of Architecture at the University of PortoMarum is the coordinator of the 5th year and teaches ''Design V'' at UBI''s Integrated Master in Architecture, and he also leads the optional course ''Architectural Design Communication''He lectures and oversees the ''Design and Building Seminar I'' in UBI''s Doctoral Program in Architecture. Throughout his tenure, he has taught various theoretical and practical subjects, primarily in Architectural Design courses, occasionally branching out to ''Urban Design'' and ''Drawing and Geometry'' from the 1st to the 5th year at UBI¿s Master in Architecture. His research involvement is as significant as his teaching. He is the lead researcher on the R&D project in collaboration with the public administration, titled "Research and Architectural Practice Project for the creation of the Trancoso Museum, Rehabilitation of the Solar dos Costas, Lopes e Tavares, and Requalification of Largo Doutor Eduardo Cabral," Ref. MDT-R2-2020, and on the project "Research and Dissemination on the Architectural and Cultural Heritage of the Historic Center of Trancoso" Ref. PAT-CHT-2019/CVP-730110000-6, ongoing since 2020He also participates in the international R&D project "Planimetric, spatial and photogrammetric analysis of pioneering audiovisual installations in the Iberian Peninsula since 1975" Ref. PGC2018-095359-B-I00 (UV-ETSA) funded by Spain''s Ministry of Science, Innovation, and Universities and the "Contrast: Network of multidisciplinary artistic initiatives in Art, Architecture, Design and Photography" (FAUP-ACC) financed by DGArtes. As a researcher, he has conducted scientific research evaluations as an expert member of the Erasmus+ Program''s R&D project proposals and final report evaluators'' pool for 2021-2027 and as an expert of the Santander Scientific Initiation Scholarship evaluators'' poolHe coordinated a highly rated R&D Unit and a 4.5 million euros architectural project obtained through an agreement between UBI and the public administration (Ref. MDT-R2-2020) Trancoso Municipality. Marum has supervised several Master''s dissertations in Architecture and currently mentors 2 Ph.D. students with FCT-funded scholarships. Several of these dissertations have been awarded scientific merit prizes in national and international student competitions, like the Valor Pneu Award and Archiprix Portugal, reflecting the scientific community''s recognition. Publicado Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Jorge Miguel Silva é licenciado em Engenharia de Sistemas Marítimos de Electrotecnia e Telecomunicações pela Escola Superior Naútica Infante D. Henrique (ENIDH, Oeiras) desde 1993, mestre em Investigação Operacional e Engenharia de Sistemas pelo Instituto Superior Técnico (IST, Lisboa) desde 1996, e doutorado em Transportes pelo IST desde 2005. Exerce atividade profiayional desde 1979, primeiro como Oficial da Marinha Mercante na Sociedade Portuguesa de Navios Tanque - SOPONATA (1979/1997), depois como Técnico de Telecomunicações Aeronaúticas na ANA - Aeroportos e Navegação Aérea (1988/1995), e finalmente como Professor na Universidade da Beira Interior (UBI), (desde 1995). Foi Presidente do Conselho Científico do Departamento de Ciências Aeroespaciais (DCA) da UBI entre 2006/2009. Atualmente é Professor Auxiliar no DCA da UBI, e Membro Integrado (até 31/12/2023) no Instituto de Investigação e Inovação em Engenharia Civil para a Sustentabilidade (CERIS) IST, Universidade de Lisboa. As áreas de atividade científica de Jorge Silva são os Transportes em geral e o Transporte Aéreo em particular, bem como a Investigação Operacional. Desde 2005 orientou/orienta 6 trabalhos de pós-doutoramento, 8 teses de doutoramento e mais de 70 dissertações de mestrado no domínio científico da Engenharia Aeronaútica. Desde 2007 participou/participa como Investigador e/ou Coordenador na UBI em 25 projetos nacionais e internacionais no âmbito da Agência de Inovação - ADI, Ministério de Fomento de España, Massachusetts Institute of Technology - MIT (orientando 7 bolseiros de investigação), LAETA, e Quadro de Referência Estratégico Nacional - QREN (orientando 3 bolseiros de investigação), entre outros. Desde 2005 publicou 1 tese de doutoramento, 10 livros, 12 capítulos de livros, 40 artigos em revistas nacionais/internacionais com revisão por pares e mais de 150 comunicações publicadas em atas de encontros científicos nacionais/internacionais. Desde 2012 faz parte de equipas de investigadores que prepararam 2 patentes na área científica da Engenharia Aeronaútica, ambas já registadas oficialmente. É Presidente da Direção da Associação de Investigação Científica em Engenharia Aeroespacial (AEROG, Universidade da Beira Interior, Covilhã, Portugal), Presidente da Assembleia Geral do Institute for Advance Studies and Awareness (IASA), Membro da Junta Diretiva da Rede Iberoamericana de Investigadores em Transporte Aéreo (RIDITA), Membro eleito da Direção da AFCEA Portugal (Associação Internacional de Comunicações e Eletrónica das Forças Armadas) - onde desempenha o cargo de Diretor de Investigação e Desenvolvimento, e Membro do Conselho Fiscal da Associação Portuguesa de Desenvolvimento Regional (APDR, membro da RSAI). Nota_Biografica: (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Jorge Miguel Silva é licenciado em Engenharia de Sistemas Marítimos de Electrotecnia e Telecomunicações pela Escola Superior Naútica Infante D. Henrique (ENIDH, Oeiras) desde 1993, mestre em Investigação Operacional e Engenharia de Sistemas pelo Instituto Superior Técnico (IST, Lisboa) desde 1996, e doutorado em Transportes pelo IST desde 2005. Exerce atividade profiayional desde 1979, primeiro como Oficial da Marinha Mercante na Sociedade Portuguesa de Navios Tanque - SOPONATA (1979/1997), depois como Técnico de Telecomunicações Aeronaúticas na ANA - Aeroportos e Navegação Aérea (1988/1995), e finalmente como Professor na Universidade da Beira Interior (UBI), (desde 1995). Foi Presidente do Conselho Científico do Departamento de Ciências Aeroespaciais (DCA) da UBI entre 2006/2009. Atualmente é Professor Auxiliar no DCA da UBI, e Membro Integrado (até 31/12/2023) no Instituto de Investigação e Inovação em Engenharia Civil para a Sustentabilidade (CERIS) IST, Universidade de Lisboa. As áreas de atividade científica de Jorge Silva são os Transportes em geral e o Transporte Aéreo em particular, bem como a Investigação Operacional. Desde 2005 orientou/orienta 6 trabalhos de pós-doutoramento, 8 teses de doutoramento e mais de 70 dissertações de mestrado no domínio científico da Engenharia Aeronaútica. Desde 2007 participou/participa como Investigador e/ou Coordenador na UBI em 25 projetos nacionais e internacionais no âmbito da Agência de Inovação - ADI, Ministério de Fomento de España, Massachusetts Institute of Technology - MIT (orientando 7 bolseiros de investigação), LAETA, e Quadro de Referência Estratégico Nacional - QREN (orientando 3 bolseiros de investigação), entre outros. Desde 2005 publicou 1 tese de doutoramento, 10 livros, 12 capítulos de livros, 40 artigos em revistas nacionais/internacionais com revisão por pares e mais de 150 comunicações publicadas em atas de encontros científicos nacionais/internacionais. Desde 2012 faz parte de equipas de investigadores que prepararam 2 patentes na área científica da Engenharia Aeronaútica, ambas já registadas oficialmente. É Presidente da Direção da Associação de Investigação Científica em Engenharia Aeroespacial (AEROG, Universidade da Beira Interior, Covilhã, Portugal), Presidente da Assembleia Geral do Institute for Advance Studies and Awareness (IASA), Membro da Junta Diretiva da Rede Iberoamericana de Investigadores em Transporte Aéreo (RIDITA), Membro eleito da Direção da AFCEA Portugal (Associação Internacional de Comunicações e Eletrónica das Forças Armadas) - onde desempenha o cargo de Diretor de Investigação e Desenvolvimento, e Membro do Conselho Fiscal da Associação Portuguesa de Desenvolvimento Regional (APDR, membro da RSAI). Concluiu o(a) Título de Agregado em Engenharia Mecânica em 2017/01/05 pelo(a) Universidade da Beira Interior e Doutoramento em Engenharia Mecânica em 2008/01/23 pelo(a) Universidade da Beira Interior. Publicou 81 artigos em revistas especializadas. Possui 4 livro(s). Recebeu 1 prémio(s) e/ou homenagens. Nas suas atividades profissionais interagiu com 188 colaborador(es) em coautorias de trabalhos científicos. No seu currículo Ciência Vitae os termos mais frequentes na contextualização da produção científica, tecnológica e artítico-cultural são: Atuadores A Plasma; Controlo Vetorial do Escoamento; Efeito de Coanda; Métodos Experimentais; Técnica Piv; Tubeira; Domínio/Área Científica::Engenharia e Tecnologia::Engenharia Mecânica; Dinâmica de gases - Métodos numéricos; Magnetohidrodinâmica (MHD); Magnetohidrodinâmica (MHD) - Escoamento compressível; Número de Mach arbitrário; Tubeira magnetoplasmadinâmica - Aplicações; Actuadores a plasma de descarga em barreira dieléctrica; Modelo de ¿plasma-fluid¿; Modelo fenomenológico; Controlo do escoamento na camada limite; JBLADE Software; Teoria do Elemento de Pá; Correções Pós-Perda; Equilíbrio 3D do escoamento; Projeto Inverso de Hélices; Simulação de Hélices em Dinâmica de Fluidos Computacional; Testes de Hélices em Túnel de Vento; Domínio/Área Científica::Ciências Naturais::Ciências Fíicas; Rotor cicloidal - Aálise cinemática; Rotor cicloidal - Modelo analítico; Rotor cicloidal - Modelação numérica tridimensional; Rotor cicloidal - Movimento harmónico; Escoamento Magnetohidrodinâmico; Mitigação do Blackout; Modelos Numéricos; Veículo automóvel - Aerodinâmica; Aerodinâmica de veículos - Evolução histórica; Aerodinâmica de veículo - Modelação experimental; Mecânica dos fluídos computacional; Shell Eco-Marathon; Modelação de turbulência; Turbomáquinas; Escoamento turbulento; Modelação de turbulência 3D; Escoamento secundário; Turbinas a gás - Aplicação aeronaútica; Coroas de pás de turbinas; Bio Mimetismo da Pele de Tubarão; Modelo de Turbulência; Redução de Atrito Aerodinâmico; Regime Turbulento; Transição; Turbulência; RANS; OpenFoam; Fluent; Bomba de discos; Número de Reynolds; Bomba de discos - Número de Reynolds; Rotor de bomba de discos; . Nota_Biografica: (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) JOSÉ CARLOS PÃSCOA MARQUES. Professor Catedrático de Engenharia Mecânica. Concluiu o(a) Título de Agregado em Engenharia Mecânica em 2017/01/05 pelo(a) Universidade da Beira Interior e Doutoramento em Engenharia Mecânica em 2008/01/23 pelo(a) Universidade da Beira Interior. Publicou 81 artigos em revistas especializadas. Possui 4 livro(s). Recebeu 1 prémio(s) e/ou homenagens. Nas suas atividades profissionais interagiu com 188 colaborador(es) em coautorias de trabalhos científicos. Provas de Agregação em Filosofia Política Medieval, na Universidade da Beira Interior, em 2020. Áreas de ensino Filosofia Medieval, Filosofia da Religião, Filosofia e Cultura, Teoria da Imagem. Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Maria Lúcia Almeida da Silva. Degree in Applied Chemistry ¿ Organic Chemistry Branch, by Faculty of Sciences and Technology at New University of Lisbon and PhD in Chemistry from the University of Beira InteriorIn 1991 she started her academic career at University of Beira Interior in the Department of Chemistry. She is Assistant Professor since 2001 at the Department of Chemistry of the Faculty of Sciences in the University of Beira Interior and she is visiting professor at the Department of Organic Chemistry of the Faculty of Sciences in the University of Granada (Spain). She is Researcher at FibEnTech - I&D Unit. Participated in several funded projects, namely Integrated Treatment of Cork Processing Wastewaters for Potential Reuse (PTDC/AGR-AAM/102042/2008); Network for the conservation and use of aromatic and medicinal plants¿ (Project AGRO 800. 8. 8.1); ReMe-diation - Resilient Mediterranean with a holistic approach to sustainable agriculture: Addressing challenges of water, soil, energy and biodiversity (PRIMA/0010/2021 (HORIZON 2020 da UE); NATBIO - Natural Biocides for Sustainable Heritage Conservation (CFPI2021/01) and	NEO4Future - Nanocapsules, (nano) porous structures and/or inclusion complexes with essential oils for fibers and textile structures (POCI-01-0247-FEDER-061912).
She has 33 publications in international peer reviewed journals indexed to Scopus and Web of Science databases; 6 book chapters and a several number of papers in actas of scientific meetings. She develops studies in the field of Natural Products Chemistry; Medicinal and Aromatics Plants; Chromatography (HPLC and GC-MS) and Spectroscopy (UV, IR; NMR and MS)Presently her scientific interest are the analysis and identification of natural products (extracted from plants or prepared by chemical synthesis) and application of "environmentally friendly techniques Projectos e Financiamentos (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Bolsa Integrated Treatment of Cork Processing Wastewaters for Potencial Reuse Provided by PTCRIS: 102042 2010 - 2013/10/ ( ) Integrated Treatment of Cork Processing Wastewaters for Potencial Reuse 102042 2010 - 2013/10/ ( ) Projeto Uma abordagem holítica para aumentar a resiliência e sustentabilidade da agricultura na região do Mediterrâneo: Enfrentando os desafios da água, solo, energia e biodiversidade PRIMA/0010/2021 2022 - 2025/5/31 ( Em curso ) Biocidas naturais para a conservação sustentável do património CFPI2021/01 2021 - 2023/9/1 ( Em curso ) Biocidas naturais para a conservação sustentável do património CFPI2021/01 2021 - 2023/9/1 ( Em curso ) Projecto Estratégico - UI 195 - 2011-2012 PEst-OE/CTM/UI0195/2011 2011 - 2013/12/31 ( Concluído ) Tratamento Integrado dos Efluentes do Processamento da Cortiça para Potencial Reutilização PTDC/AGR-AAM/102042/2008 2010 - 2013/10/31 ( Concluído ) Mais Info Principais áreas de Interesse Científico: Síntese de moléculas bioactivas Plantas Aromáticas e Medicinais Óleos essências Técnicas de extracção “amigas do ambiente” (SPME) Cromatografia (GC-MS, HPLC) Determinação estrutural (IV, RMN 1H, RMN 13C, RMN bidimensional, Espectrometria de Massa) Publicações Publicações mais relevantes: “Enantioselective Total Synthesis of the Potent Anti-inflammatory (+)-Myrrhanol A”  Victoriano Domingo, Lúcia Silva, Horacio R. Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Luis Mendes trabalha na Universidade da Beira Interior (Portugal) como professor auxiliar nas áreas de Gestão da Qualidade Gestão da Produção e das operações. Doutorou-se em Gestão pela Universidade da Beira Interior, após uma participação anterior no Programa Europeu de Doutoramento em Empreendedorismo e Gestão de Pequenas Empresas (em Barcelona - Espanha e Växjö - Suécia). Os seus recentes interesses de investigação incluem o papel geral das partes interessadas na gestão da qualidade, a abordagem estratégica de Recursos Humanos na gestão da mudança e na gestão de serviços públicos, a gestão da qualidade e o seu papel na sustentabilidade. As suas atividades de investigação têm sido desenvolvidas no Centro de Estudos Avançados em Gestão e Economia (CEFAGE-UBI), Covilhã, Portugal.

 
Luis Mendes (lmendes@ubi.pt) is working at the University of Beira Interior (Portugal) as professor in the fields of Quality Management, and Production and Operations Management. He received his PhD in business at the University of Beira Interior, after a previous participation in the European Doctoral Program in Entrepreneurship and Small Business Management (in Barcelona - Spain and Växjö - Sweeden). His recent research interests include the general role of Stakeholders in quality management, the Human Resources strategic approach in managing change, and in public services management, and Quality management''s role in sustainability. His research activities have been developed at the Advanced Studies in Management & Economics Research Center (CEFAGE-UBI), Covilhã, Portugal. Contactos lmendesðubi÷pt 275319845 4045 CienciaVitae.pt

Text: Sector  — Cargos/Funções Departamento de Sociologia — Docente do Departamento de Sociologia Mais Info Nota Biográfica Professor Auxiliar de Relações Internacionais na Universidade da Beira Interior (UBI). Investigador Integrado do PRAXIS - Centro de Filosofia, Política e Cultura da UBI. É doutorado em Relacoes Internacionais pelo Department of International Politics da Universidade do País de Gales em Aberystwyth e doutorado em Filosofia pela Universidade de Uppsala. Publicou em 2017, pela Routledge, o livro Reinhold Niebuhr and International Relations Theory: Realism Beyond Thomas Hobbes . Os seus interesses de investigação concentram-se sobretudo na teoria das relações internacionais, na filosofia política e na história do direito internacional, com particular enfoque nos direitos humanos e no regime migratório global. Publicado Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Português- Mafalda Fonseca é licenciada em Bioquímica pela Universidade de Coimbra (1991-1996), e doutorada em 2003 pela Universidade do Porto (Imunologia). O pós-doutoramento foi na Faculdade de Ciências da Saúde da Universidade da Beira Interior (Imunologia Clínica) , e parte dele na Universidade de Monash em Melbourne (Austrália). Desde 2004, é docente na Faculdade de Ciências da Saúde da UBI (Covilhã)Das atividades de investigação resultaram cerca de 40 publicações com foco nas respostas imunitárias celulares em contexto fisiológicos e patologias de base imunitária como as alergias e a Esclerose MúltiplaEnglish- Mafalda Fonseca has a BsC in Biochemistry obtained at the University of Coimbra in 1996. The doctorate project took place at the Institute for Molecular and Cell Biology, University of Porto, in the field of Immunology and it was finished in 2003. The postdoctoral project was at the Faculty of Health Sciences of the University of Beira Interior in Covilhã, in the field of Clinical Immunology, Allergology. Part of the post-doctoral work was performed at the department. of Immunology at the University of Monash in Melbourne (Australia). Since 2004, she is a Assistant profesor at the Health Sciences Faculty of the UBI. The research activities oiginated about 40 publications mainly focused on cellular immune responses both in physiological context as in diseases based on imunological events such as Alergy, Multiple Sclerosis, Hypertension and Chronic Kidney Disease. Distinções e Prémios (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Prémio 2007 Travel award - European Academy of Allergy and Clinical Immunology (EAACI) , Zurich , Zurich , Suiça 2006 Travel grant - Text: Sector  — Cargos/Funções Departamento de Química — Docente do Departamento de Química CICS - Centro de Investigação em Ciências da Saúde — Investigador/a Unidades Curriculares Análises Químico-Biológicas de Aplicação à Clínica (8440)2023 Processos Bioquímicos da Hematopoiese (8867)2023 Bioquímica Clínica (12823)2023 Análises Químico-Biológicas de Aplicação à Clínica (12885)2023 Bioquímica Clínica (13544)2023 Mais Info Principais áreas de interesse  científico: Actividade Científica desenvolvida em colaboração com  diferentes instituições e integrando equipas multidisciplinares a realizar  trabalho de investigação em diferentes modelos fisiológicos, como a gravidez e  o exercício físico, e em modelos patológicos, incluindo doenças  cardiovasculares, obesidade e diabetes, psoríase, gravidez pré-eclamptica,  insuficiência renal crónica, anemia hemolítica hereditária e cancro. O mais  recente projecto tem como objectivo o estudo da acção farmacológica e  toxicológica dos ácidos retinóicos e em combinação com anti-estrogénios, na  psoríase e no cancro. Text: Sector  — Cargos/Funções Departamento de Ciências Médicas — Docente do Departamento de Ciências Médicas Publicações Científicas Mais Recentes (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Mariana Matias is graduated in Pharmaceutical Sciences since 2011 and PhD at the University of Beira Interior since 2018. After a Community Pharmacy experience, Mariana was a Postdoctoral Researcher at the Research Institute for Medicines (iMed.ULisboa), integrated in the Faculty of Pharmacy of the University of Lisbon. At this moment, she plays a role as Medical Writer in Phagecon and as Invited Assistant Professor in the University of Beira Interior. Over the years, her main scientific interests have been Pharmaceutical and Medicinal Chemistry, Pharmaco-toxicology, Nanotechnology and Therapeutics, and has mainly worked on the design, chemical synthesis, biological evaluation and nanoformulation of different heterocyclic compounds. Mariana published several papers in peer-reviewed journals and book chapters and was authored/co-authored of several communications at scientific meetings (12 oral communications and 29 poster presentations). She co-supervised several students and has participated as jury of academic degrees in courses of Pharmaceutical Sciences, Biochemistry, Biomedical Sciences, Biotechnology and Industrial Chemistry. Motricidad Humana: hacia una vida más saludable, Rede Euroamericana de Motricidade Humana, Chile, Méx", 2015. Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Mário C. Marques is the Head and full Professor of Training Theory and Methodology in the Department of Sports Sciences at the University of Beira Interior. He also holds an appointment as a Head of Strength and Conditioning performance analysis team of the CIDESD. Additionally, he is serving as Strength and Conditioning consultant for the Portuguese Swimming Federation. Collaborator in several funded projects focused on frailty and exercise to promote and recommend changes in lifestyle associated with physical exercise for frail patients at risk of functional decline and MID-FRAIL to test the efficacy of a multimodal intervention in prefrail/frail older patients. His current research interests include the neuromuscular biomechanics of muscle strength and power. Nota_Biografica: (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Mário C. Marques is the Head and full Professor of Training Theory and Methodology in the Department of Sports Sciences at the University of Beira Interior. He also holds an appointment as a Head of Strength and Conditioning performance analysis team of the CIDESD. Additionally, he is serving as Strength and Conditioning consultant for the Portuguese Swimming Federation. Collaborator in several funded projects focused on frailty and exercise to promote and recommend changes in lifestyle associated with physical exercise for frail patients at risk of functional decline and MID-FRAIL to test the efficacy of a multimodal intervention in prefrail/frail older patients. His current research interests include the neuromuscular biomechanics of muscle strength and power. Publicado Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Mário Franco is an Associate Professor of Entrepreneurship and small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) Administration at the Department of Management and Economics, Universidade da Beira Interior (UBI), Portugal. He received his PhD in Management from UBI in 2002. In 1997, he was a doctoral candidate and participated in the European Doctoral Programme in Entrepreneurship and Small Business Management in Barcelona (Spain) and Vaxjo (Sweden). He holds a MA in Management from the UBI and a BA in Management from the same university. His research focuses on entrepreneurship, strategic alliances, inter-organizational networks, innovation, sustainability and business creation. He has authored (or co-authored) more than 200 articles, 20 books and about 42 chapters, including publications in the Long Range Planning, Management Decision, R&D Management, Journal of Environmental Management, Journal of Management & Organization, Journal of Engineering and Technology Management, International Entrepreneurship and Management Journal, Journal of Business & Industrial Marketing, European Journal of Innovation Management, Service Business, Review of Managerial Science, Cities, Journal Cleaner Production, among other. He has also supervised sixty master dissertations, 12 doctoral thesis and has acted as a reviewer/evaluator for more than 30 international scientific journals. He is also a member of a Research Unit (CEFAGE-UBI) and currently involved in several research projects on SMEs. Text: Sector  — Cargos/Funções Departamento de Engenharia Civil e Arquitetura — Docente do Departamento de Civil e Arquitetura C-MADE | Centre of Materials and Building Technologies — Investigador/a Biografia Marisa Dinis de Almeida joined the University of Beira Interior (UBI) in 1999. She is an Assistant Professor since 2011 having obtained a PhD in Civil Engineering on that date. She teaches several disciplines in Civil Engineering and Architecture courses. She is an expert in pavement research, materials, design, construction and performance evaluation pavement, and she has author or co-author of papers and communications in national and international journals and scientific meetings. Ver CV Resumido Unidades Curriculares Direção e Gestão de Obras (10296)2023 Materiais de Construção I (14638)2023 Construção I (15163)2023 Construção II (15207)2023 Direção e Gestão de Obras (15297)2023 Direção e Gestão de Obras (15323)2023 Mais Info Research Interests Atividade de investigação desenvolvida no âmbito dos materiais para pavimentação e tecnologias de construção inovadoras, nomeadamente na utilização de materiais reciclados e soluções de baixo impacto. Os seus interesses de investigação atuais centram-se no desenvolvimento e avaliação do desempenho de soluções económica e ambientalmente sustentáveis para pavimentação rodoviária. Research activity with development in the scope of materials engineering for pavement and innovative construction technologies, namely in use of recycled materials and low impact solutions. Current research interests: Development and performance evaluation of economical and environmentally sustainable solutions for road paving, in mitigating and adapting to climate change. Pharmacy (2021) url Nota Biográfica (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Olga Lourenço is a dedicated academic and researcher in the field of clinical immunology. She has a PharmD from the Faculty of Pharmacy at the University of Coimbra. Her passion for understanding the intricacies of immunological responses led her to earn a master''s degree in Clinical Immunology from the Faculty of Health Sciences at the University of Beira Interior in 2004. With a profound interest in non-communicable respiratory diseases, Olga pursued and successfully obtained a Ph.D. in Biomedicine from the Faculty of Health Sciences at the University of Beira Interior in 2008. She is an integrated member of the Health Sciences Research Centre at the University of Beira Interior (CICS-UBI), contributing significantly to the field of clinical immunology. Beyond her academic pursuits, Olga is actively involved in various professional and allergy-related organizations, reflecting her commitment to advancing medical knowledge and patient care. Currently serving as an Assistant Professor at the University of Beira Interior, Olga Lourenço is deeply engaged in academic and research activities. Her contributions extend to several vital committees and roles within the academic community, including membership in the Teaching and Training Committee (CEF) of the Centro Académico Clínico das Beiras. She is also an active participant in the Integrated Master''s Course Committee in Pharmaceutical Sciences and is a member of the General Council at the University of Beira Interior. Her remarkable journey includes being the former vice president for Management and Teaching at the Faculty of Health Sciences and the past Course Director of the Integrated Master in Pharmaceutical Sciences at the same institution. A prolific author, Olga has published over fifty full papers in specialized journals and has contributed to the knowledge in her field with three book chapters. Her expertise is further demonstrated through her supervisory role, having guided forty-two master''s dissertations. Engaged as an Investigator, she has made valuable contributions to various research projects. Olga''s research endeavors revolve around the immunopathology and epidemiology of non-communicable respiratory diseases, with a particular focus on conditions such as rhinitis, asthma, and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. She also extends her expertise to exploring inflammatory biomarkers in diverse contexts, including recent investigations in neurodegeneration and exercise. Through her extensive academic contributions and unwavering dedication to advancing clinical immunology, Olga Lourenço continues to make a profound impact on both research and education in her field. Nota_Biografica: (Informação importada da plataforma CiênciaVitae ) Olga Lourenço is a dedicated academic and researcher in the field of clinical immunology. She has a PharmD from the Faculty of Pharmacy at the University of Coimbra. Her passion for understanding the intricacies of immunological responses led her to earn a master''s degree in Clinical Immunology from the Faculty of Health Sciences at the University of Beira Interior in 2004. With a profound interest in non-communicable respiratory diseases, Olga pursued and successfully obtained a Ph.D. in Biomedicine from the Faculty of Health Sciences at the University of Beira Interior in 2008. She is an integrated member of the Health Sciences Research Centre at the University of Beira Interior (CICS-UBI), contributing significantly to the field of clinical immunology. Beyond her academic pursuits, Olga is actively involved in various professional and allergy-related organizations, reflecting her commitment to advancing medical knowledge and patient care. Currently serving as an Assistant Professor at the University of Beira Interior, Olga Lourenço is deeply engaged in academic and research activities. Her contributions extend to several vital committees and roles within the academic community, including membership in the Teaching and Training Committee (CEF) of the Centro Académico Clínico das Beiras. She is also an active participant in the Integrated Master''s Course Committee in Pharmaceutical Sciences and is a member of the General Council at the University of Beira Interior. Her remarkable journey includes being the former vice president for Management and Teaching at the Faculty of Health Sciences and the past Course Director of the Integrated Master in Pharmaceutical Sciences at the same institution. A prolific author, Olga has published over fifty full papers in specialized journals and has contributed to the knowledge in her field with three book chapters. Her expertise is further demonstrated through her supervisory role, having guided forty-two master''s dissertations. Engaged as an Investigator, she has made valuable contributions to various research projects. Olga''s research endeavors revolve around the immunopathology and epidemiology of non-communicable respiratory diseases, with a particular focus on conditions such as rhinitis, asthma, and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. She also extends her expertise to exploring inflammatory biomarkers in diverse contexts, including recent investigations in neurodegeneration and exercise. Through her extensive academic contributions and unwavering dedication to advancing clinical immunology, Olga Lourenço continues to make a profound impact on both research and education in her field.
